content.description:
Climb up cracks and face moves to the climbers left of "Nose Goblins". Work the thin crack above the slab eventually reaching for holds out left. A spectacular line, but too thin to be beautiful. (summerprophet)

2 top anchored bolts, gear to 1".

Tiny crimps and side clings on this short route with a 5.12c crux after the first two bolts. Two more bolts for an easier climb to the finish.

Link the lower half Revelations route (5.10c) to finish this route.


2 top anchor bolts, supposed to be 9 bolts along the way, not sure if it's from the bottom of the route or from the midway to the end.

Fun splitter crack through a slab. (lichenmuncher)

2 top anchored bolts, gear to 3".

Looks like a big ole chimney to get through.

2 top anchored bolts, trad friendly.

Scramble up to the ledge to begin an incredible stem fest. Face climbing above.
The only route guaranteed to give your asscheeks cramps.
(summer prophet)

This route is rough on rope. Very abrasive rocks near the top half that your rope will consistently rub on will rapidly wear your rope.
Looking for a technical crux? You found it! An easy scramble to a large ledge that will make you think how to reach a couple distant crack holds that aren't as great as you want them to be. Once you get past that, you get to a ceiling that makes you wish you didn't waste your energy on the crux. After that, take it slow and easy to regain energy on a crimpy last portion.
(Ben Eisele)

2 top anchored bolts, gear to very small - 2.5".

It's got to be one big crack...

2 top bolt anchors.

Comfortably numb, hmmmm I wonder why...?

2 top bolted anchors, gear to 0.5".

A lot of ledges, a safe and easy top rope. (Tylers_outdoors)

2 top anchored bolts, gear to 2".

The beginning starts out with some funky moves, be creative. The crux starts at a thin line on the last quarter of the route, get ready to shred your fingers. After the crux you finish on big easy holds.

2 top anchor bolts with 5 bolts along the route.

Runout traverse.

2 top anchored bolts, gear to 2".

Can be climbed as a 5.7 to mid anchors. 

2 top bolted anchors, gear to 2".

Follow the crack / overhang angling right after the Dreamer anchors. (SteveUpsidedown)

Follow up Dreamer (5.11a) route to reach this route.

2 top bolted anchors, gear to 1".

Route begins with a good few powerful crux moves and then mellows down for a easier finish.

2 top bolt anchors.

Plenty of lateral movement in this one, enjoy!

Gear to 2".

Legend has it that this is a popular free solo route...

Face climbing gets you a big roof right in the face, then a few feet of easy ground, then the funky second roof, once firmly in the cracks above it jam your way to the top. (lichenmuncher)

Nice climb, good holds, no runouts.
Left hand reacharound to a good hold for the first roof, layback the second. (TumblerRidgeCraig)

2 top anchored bolts, gear to 2.5".

The first bolt is located between Anorexia Crack and Shake N' Bake. follow the bolts over the overhang. The rappel anchors are there. If you have ambition and trad gear, follow the crack right on Dashed Dreams (11b). Or if you're a real man take Wake Up! (12+) straight up the face.
(SteveUpsidedown)

5 bolts leading up to the anchors.

Short crack climb to launch back on. Perfect for newbies and intro trad climbing.


2 top anchored bolts, gear to 2".

Free soloing anyone?

Whatever you place for protection

There are actually two routes to include on this anchor located climbers left of Hissy Fit. There is a gear climb / toprope that goes off to the right at the ledge halfway up. This is rated 5.9 on the face plate but I would put it at 5.10b. If you climb this variation, heading left at the bottom is more consistent with difficulty than following the bolts. There is also a sport bolted route that goes slightly off to the left at the ledge. This is a 5.11b climb. Prudent climbers may want to climb the big rock and stick clip the second bolt. Warning: The sport route seems dangerous. The second anchor is too high. A fall while clipping would probably result in hitting the ground, and the third clip is pretty sketchy as well. The second last clip in spot has a loose bolt hanger, but the bolt seems solid enough.... The top bolt has no anchor, but it's only about 15 feet from the second last bolt to the top and this is not a major falling hazard area. The anchors are good. If climbing the 5.10b way on topropte, there is also a small pendulum danger. NOTE: While working this route, my brother noticed that a major undercling on the sport route was loose. We rapped down with crowbars, and worked the rock a bit. A very large boulder broke off. Deadly if anyone was underneath, but we'd cleared the area first. The moral is, use common sense when climbing, the guy who made the route may have missed something. The missing undercling makes the route only marginally harder. (SteveUpsidedown)

2 top anchored bolts, 2 bolts along the route, gear to 1.5".

Looks like a short crack climb, fists required.

Gear to 3".

Starts with the best jugs into a harder section with the best resting spot to lay  into. After that you get to the crux with a thin crack and some crimps to make you work harder and harder, right to the top.

2 chains

Obvious Hand and fist crack to the climbers left of Baby Snakes. (summerprophet)


Gear to 3".

Small runout on the face above the corner, not bad though.
Goes from a left-facing corner, to face, to a couple of cracks sperated by a ledge. (TumblerRidgeCraig)

2 top anchor bolts, gear to 2.5".

Looks like a tough start to a nice 5.6 finish.


Gear to 2".

Route is just left of Couch Trip. Start up the crack that follows all the way to the top. 
Beginning crux but rewards slick layback, route shares anchors with Couch Trip.

2 top bolt anchors. Gear to 2"

Bush rats have infested this climb.

2 top anchored bolts, gear to 6".

Retro bolted by Andrew Neis in April 2018.

Route begins with an early crux, once you stick the big undercling enjoy the beautiful cracks to the top!

2 top bolt anchors, 6 bolts along the route.

Awesome layback to start, then a bit of a squeeze next with a roof climb to follow, then a midpoint crux.

2 top bolted anchors, gear to 2".

Slightly technical first half off of the flake in the ground.  Take a good rest on the huge ledge as it gets a lot tougher for the last half.  Work the crimps a bit to the left and get those feet up.  A couple decent underclings to pull you up on the tiny ledge.  Traverse to the right to grab a couple mini jugs and lift those feet high for the foot holds requires to make it up the rest of this climb.  Lot's of variety in this climb and it will quickly punish you for poor foot positioning.

2 top anchor bolts, 7 bolts along route, gear to 1.5".

Technical crux near the start with poor pocket and crimp.  Follow the crack to the small ceiling and get over it with some small crimps and flexible leg work.  Slab mid section to get some energy back.  A tough section after that with another crux immediately after the tiny ceiling.  Use the crack and poor crimps too top out just left of the anchors.


2 top bolted anchors.

Not a lot known about this route yet, someone enlighten us!

2 top anchor bolts with chains, 4 bolts along route, gear to 2".

Have fun dangling from a fist jam under this monster roof. (lichenmuncher)

2 top anchored bolts, gear to 3.5".

Immediately right of Dust to Dust.

Three different cracks/off widths to give a variety of move options. 


2 top anchored bolts.

Overly rad route with an interesting lip to get over, enjoy the views along the route!

2 top anchored bolts, gear to 3.5".

Tagged as Comfortably Numb.

Solid climb with a mix of crimps and jugs and viscious ants at the top.



Anchor off Comfortably Numb.

2 bolts

Starts left of Wendy standing on top of the slab. Cross with Wendy at the first overhang and keep going right. Try to think some happy thoughts at the second overhang. (SteveUpsidedown)

2 top anchored bolts with 11 bolts along the route.

Looks fun, give it a go!

2 top bolted anchors, gear to 0.5".

Crux start?

Bolts on the wall

Lots of crack climbing in this route, half way crux with poor footholds. Follow the bolts up!

Fixed bolts on top with 2 bolts mid wall, mixed route.

Climb the beutiful right facing corner to the roof. Grope around above the roof for blind holds and pull through to the thin seam above. Please check the pitons at the beginning of the climbing season. (summerprophet)

2 top bolted anchors. Gear to 1/2".

Follow bolts to anchors midway up the wall, feel free to link up with Armageddon Destructor (5.12c) if you're feeling ambitious! 

4 bolts to a 2 anchor finish

Beautiful crimpy route with an early crux. The finish of the route can prove to be challenging too...

Bolts are a bit run out so this one requires good courage on lead...

2 top anchored bolts with chains, 5  bolts along the route.

Starts in the upper cave to Climbers' left of Weekend Warrior and The Warrior's Way, using both walls, before working onto the face, following the diagonal flake to a mantle finish at the top. When transiting from the cave remember to set a directional so your rope doesn't get pinched between the rocks. (DJDaimon)

2 Anchors on top, gear to 1.5".

About 30' of exposed face climbing rewards the climber with a couple flakes and these awesome paralel twin cracks that shoot for the top. (lichenmuncher)

Starts up a separated flake, onto face, up to a couple flakes, then into a great hand crack at the top section.
Great fun, lots of pro. One of my favs at this crag
3rd trad lead ever. (TumblerRidgeCraig)

A fun route, going to do it with gear this summer. A nice crack. An easy 5.9. not much for exposure, still a little slabby. (Tylers_outdoors)

2 top anchored bolts, gear up to 3".

Climb Hissy Fit to top of crack, then angle right along the line of weakness to the anchors of Wanglin.

Trad route

Shares the first bolt with Peter Pan and then moves left up the face. Short and pumpy. (SteveUpsidedown)

2 top bolted anchors, 3 bolts along route.

A unique flake that you think you should just walk up but can't. Lot's of big ledges to rest on. A crux with some crimps and a raspberry bush in your way. An easy crack that you can foot jamb to finish off the climb. Bring long slings to anchor off the bolts to avoid your rope dragging near the anchor. Great warm up climb for this far away area.
(Ben Eisele)


2 top bolted anchors needing two double length slings, gear to 3.

Fun crack climb, crux near the end of the route.

2 top bolts with chain, gear to 2".

A ballsy route that kicks it off with a big roof and never relents. Named after the ground fall taken from the roof while working and cleaning the route (thus the bolt). (lichenmuncher)

Cleaned this route and hit the ground during the first TR attempt. The name is inspired from that event. A lot of work was put into cleaning the massive flakes off of the start of this climb. Enjoy this one, it wasn't easy to build. (summerprophet)

2 top anchored bolts, gear up to 1".

Enjoy the tunnelling :)

Two top anchored bolts, gear to 4".

Starts on top of dragon feature, choose your favourite way up!

2 top anchor bolts, gear to 18mm.

Route follows right of the big beginning crack feature, continue enjoyable crack climbing to a crux finish.

Find Jay in the Shade, and the route is the next one to the left of it.
2 top anchored bolts with 6 bolts along the route.

I recommend to run a static line to access the top bolts if you top rope, they're in a rather exposed and steep location.Route begins with a strange pocket to climb up, enjoy the nice holds until the crux hits between the 4th and 5th bolts. There are a few rest spots after the crux, fight the pump and finish it up!Bolted by Andrew Neis April 2018

First route on the far left side of the crag
8 bolts along the route with 2 top anchored bolts with chains.

If attempting this after Dreamer, take a good rest!
A decent undercling, more bad footing than good and a bunch of angled crimps will punish your fingertips on this short climb.
(Ben Eisele)

2 top anchor bolts with 3 bolts along the route. If you start from Dreamer, 9 bolts along the way until you hit the anchors.

Grab the crimps on the right and the left edge hugging the wall to work your way up this short and fun climb.

1 top anchored bolt

Climb the off width crack only to the left of Wall Hug.  It looks harder near the beginning but it turns out to be the other way around.

1 bolt at the top used for Wall Hug

Route begins with a crimpy crux then follows nice lines up to a roof where you can can go to the left (easier), or right crack (harder). Beware of the loose rock near the top in the middle of a crack!

2 top anchored bolts, 1 bolt along route, gear to 3".

Climb bottom of Way of the Warrior, then traverse right under roof to anchor of Weekend Warrior.

2 top anchored bolts, gear to 2.5".

Looks like a bunch of horizontal movement In this one.

Two top anchored bolts, 1 bolt along route, gear to 2.5".

Avoid the solid red stem...

2 top bolted anchors, gear to 2".

This route starts on the big slab to the left of the Quick and the Dead. It climbs up the slab to the big overhang and then moves directly left, crossing paths with Peter Pan, to where the overhang has an easy boulder. Then the route moves up and touches with the right most part of Texas Tunnel. (SteveUpsidedown)

2 top bolted anchors, 6 bolts along the route.

Upper section is a bit of a mystery from the topo but it looks interesting, someone try it!

2 top anchored bolts

Do the Retro BJ start and then go to the left instead of right. Crosses over to Will to Live a bit. Doesn't get climbed much so may be a bit mossy.

2 bolts and chains

Secluded quartzite rock crag south facing. 20+/-m cliffs, 60+ routes.

Sport, top-rope, bouldering & trad climbing.
